title: QA & Software Testing Engineer
summary: Ensure software quality, reliability, and user satisfaction through systematic testing, automation, and validation processes.

steps.title: Software Testing Basics (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn testing principles, SDLC, STLC, defect lifecycle, test case design techniques, and ISTQB Foundation concepts.

quiz.question: What is SDLC?
quiz.explanation: SDLC defines stages from planning to deployment.

quiz.question: What is STLC?
quiz.explanation: STLC covers test planning, design, execution, closure.

quiz.question: What is a test case?
options: Document with test steps and expected results

quiz.question: What is defect lifecycle?
options: Stages of a bug from detection to closure
quiz.explanation: Defect lifecycle tracks bug status changes.

quiz.question: What is verification?
options: Are we building the product right?
Are we building the right product?
quiz.explanation: Verification checks if product meets specifications.

quiz.question: What is validation?
options: Are we building the right product?
Are we building the product right?
quiz.explanation: Validation ensures product meets user needs.

quiz.question: What is test plan?
quiz.explanation: Test plans define scope, approach, resources, schedule.

quiz.question: What is a test scenario?
quiz.explanation: Scenarios describe what to test, not how.

quiz.question: What is test data?
quiz.explanation: Test data includes valid, invalid, and edge cases.

quiz.question: What are entry criteria?
quiz.explanation: Entry criteria ensure readiness for testing.

quiz.question: What are test metrics?
quiz.explanation: Metrics include coverage, defects, pass/fail rates.

quiz.question: What is defect severity?
options: Impact of bug on system functionality

quiz.question: What is defect priority?
quiz.explanation: Priority: high, medium, low based on business.

quiz.question: What is root cause analysis?
quiz.explanation: Root cause analysis prevents future defects.

quiz.question: What is test closure?
options: Final testing phase with summary report

quiz.question: What is risk-based testing?
options: Prioritizing tests based on risk level
quiz.explanation: Risk-based testing focuses on critical areas.

steps.title: Testing Types & Techniques (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Master functional vs non-functional testing, black box/white box testing, regression, smoke, sanity, integration, system, and acceptance testing.

quiz.question: What is black box testing?
quiz.explanation: Black box focuses on inputs and outputs.

quiz.question: What is regression testing?
quiz.explanation: Regression ensures new changes don't break existing features.

quiz.question: What is smoke testing?
options: Quick preliminary test of critical features

quiz.question: What is sanity testing?
quiz.explanation: Sanity testing validates bug fixes or new features.

quiz.question: What is UAT?
options: User Acceptance Testing by end users
quiz.explanation: UAT validates software meets business needs.

quiz.question: What is boundary value analysis?
quiz.explanation: Boundary testing finds edge case defects.

quiz.question: What is unit testing?
quiz.explanation: Unit testing is done by developers.

quiz.question: What is alpha testing?
quiz.explanation: Alpha testing finds bugs in controlled environment.

quiz.question: What is usability testing?
options: Testing user experience and ease of use

quiz.question: What is end-to-end testing?
options: Testing complete workflow from start to finish
quiz.explanation: E2E testing validates entire user journey.

steps.title: Manual Testing & Documentation (5-7 weeks)
steps.description: Learn test planning, test case writing, bug reporting with Jira, exploratory testing, and ad-hoc testing techniques.

resources.title: How to Write Effective Bug Reports

quiz.question: What is test planning?
quiz.explanation: Test planning outlines scope, approach, schedule.

quiz.question: What is a test case?
quiz.explanation: Test cases include preconditions, steps, expected results.

quiz.question: What is Jira?
options: Bug tracking and project management tool
quiz.explanation: Jira manages issues, sprints, and workflows.

quiz.question: What is a bug report?
options: Document detailing a defect with steps to reproduce
quiz.explanation: Bug reports help developers understand and fix issues.

quiz.question: What is exploratory testing?
quiz.explanation: Exploratory testing relies on tester creativity.

quiz.question: What is ad-hoc testing?
quiz.explanation: Ad-hoc testing is unstructured and random.

quiz.question: What is test execution?
options: Running test cases and logging results
quiz.explanation: Execution validates actual vs expected results.

quiz.question: What is traceability matrix?
options: Document mapping requirements to test cases
quiz.explanation: Traceability ensures all requirements are tested.

quiz.question: What is test summary report?
options: Final report with test metrics and results

quiz.question: What is a test suite?
quiz.explanation: Test suites organize tests by feature or module.

quiz.question: What is defect tracking?
quiz.explanation: Defect tracking uses tools like Jira, Bugzilla.

quiz.question: What's difference between severity and priority?
options: Severity is impact, priority is urgency
quiz.explanation: Severity: technical impact, priority: business urgency.

quiz.question: What is test strategy?
quiz.explanation: Test strategy defines testing principles and methods.

quiz.question: What is session-based testing?
options: Structured exploratory testing in time-boxed sessions
quiz.explanation: Session-based testing balances exploration and structure.

quiz.question: What is a charter?
options: Goal and scope for exploratory test session

quiz.question: What's difference between smoke and sanity?
options: Smoke tests build stability, sanity tests specific changes
quiz.explanation: Smoke is broader, sanity is targeted.

quiz.question: What are acceptance criteria?
options: Conditions for feature to be accepted

steps.title: Programming for QA (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Master Python or JavaScript for test automation. Learn OOP, data structures, and programming fundamentals for QA engineers.

quiz.question: Why learn programming for QA?
quiz.explanation: Programming enables automated testing at scale.

quiz.question: What is Python?
quiz.explanation: Python is popular for test automation.

quiz.question: What is OOP?
quiz.explanation: OOP uses classes and objects for code organization.

quiz.question: What is a list in Python?
quiz.explanation: Lists store multiple values in order.

quiz.question: What is JavaScript?
quiz.explanation: JavaScript is essential for web testing.

quiz.question: What is a variable?
quiz.explanation: Variables hold values that can change.

quiz.question: What is a loop?
quiz.explanation: Loops iterate over data or repeat actions.

quiz.question: What is a class?
quiz.explanation: Classes define object properties and methods.

quiz.question: What are data types?
options: Categories of data: int, string, bool, float

quiz.question: What are modules?
quiz.explanation: Modules organize code and enable imports.

quiz.question: What is file handling?
quiz.explanation: File handling manages test data and logs.

quiz.question: What are regular expressions?
quiz.explanation: Regex validates strings and extracts data.

quiz.question: What is an IDE?
quiz.explanation: IDEs like PyCharm, VS Code aid development.

quiz.question: What is Git?
quiz.explanation: Git tracks code changes and collaboration.

quiz.question: What is code review?
quiz.explanation: Code review improves test script quality.

steps.title: Selenium WebDriver (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Master web automation with Selenium including locators, WebDriver architecture, Page Object Model, and best practices.

quiz.question: What is a locator?
quiz.explanation: Locators identify elements by ID, class, XPath, etc.

quiz.question: What is XPath?
quiz.explanation: XPath locates elements in DOM tree.

quiz.question: What is Page Object Model?
options: Design pattern separating page elements and tests
quiz.explanation: POM improves test maintainability and reusability.

quiz.question: What is implicit wait?
quiz.explanation: Implicit wait applies to all elements.

quiz.question: What is explicit wait?
quiz.explanation: Explicit wait targets specific elements or conditions.

quiz.question: What is headless browser?
quiz.explanation: Headless mode runs faster in CI/CD.

quiz.question: What are CSS selectors?
options: Patterns to select elements by CSS properties
quiz.explanation: CSS selectors are faster than XPath.

quiz.question: What is fluent wait?
options: Wait with polling interval and timeout

quiz.question: What is stale element?
options: Element no longer attached to DOM

steps.title: Modern Test Automation Frameworks (6-8 weeks)
steps.description: Learn Cypress for modern web testing, Playwright for cross-browser testing, and Puppeteer for headless Chrome automation.

quiz.question: What is Cypress?
quiz.explanation: Cypress provides fast, reliable web testing.

quiz.question: What is Playwright?
quiz.explanation: Playwright supports Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge.

quiz.question: What is Puppeteer?
options: Node library for headless Chrome automation

quiz.question: What advantage does Cypress have?
options: Fast execution with time travel debugging
quiz.explanation: Cypress runs in the browser with excellent DX.

quiz.question: What is auto-waiting?
options: Automatic waiting for elements to be ready

quiz.question: What is test retry?
quiz.explanation: Retries reduce false negatives from flakiness.

steps.title: API Testing (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Master API testing with Postman, REST Assured, and automated API testing. Learn HTTP methods, status codes, and API test automation.

quiz.question: What is REST?
quiz.explanation: REST uses HTTP methods for web services.

quiz.question: What is Postman?
quiz.explanation: Postman simplifies API testing and documentation.

quiz.question: What is REST Assured?
quiz.explanation: REST Assured automates REST API tests.

quiz.question: What is JSON?
quiz.explanation: JSON is common API data format.

quiz.question: What is Newman?
options: CLI tool for running Postman collections
quiz.explanation: Newman enables CI/CD integration for Postman.

quiz.question: What are environments?
options: Variables for different setups (dev, staging, prod)

quiz.question: What is request chaining?
options: Using response data in subsequent requests

steps.title: Mobile Testing (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn mobile testing basics and Appium for mobile automation on Android and iOS devices.

quiz.question: What is mobile testing?
quiz.explanation: Mobile testing covers iOS and Android apps.

quiz.question: What is Appium?
quiz.explanation: Appium automates native, hybrid, and mobile web apps.

quiz.question: What is hybrid app?
options: App with web and native components
quiz.explanation: Hybrid apps use web views within native wrapper.

quiz.question: What is emulator?
quiz.explanation: Emulators mimic device behavior for testing.

quiz.question: What is gesture testing?
quiz.explanation: Gestures are unique to mobile interactions.

quiz.question: What is device fragmentation?
options: Variety of devices, OS versions, screen sizes

quiz.question: What is APK?
options: Android Package Kit for Android apps
quiz.explanation: APK is Android app installation file.

quiz.question: What is IPA?
quiz.explanation: IPA is iOS app installation file.

quiz.question: What's difference between simulator and emulator?
What is deep linking?
quiz.explanation: Deep linking navigates to specific app content.

steps.title: Performance Testing (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Master performance testing with JMeter, Gatling, and k6. Learn load testing, stress testing, and performance optimization.

quiz.question: What is performance testing?
options: Testing speed, scalability, stability under load
quiz.explanation: Performance testing ensures systems handle expected load.

quiz.question: What is load testing?
options: Testing system under expected user load
quiz.explanation: Load testing validates normal usage conditions.

quiz.question: What is stress testing?
options: Testing beyond normal capacity to find breaking point

quiz.question: What is JMeter?
quiz.explanation: JMeter simulates user load on servers.

quiz.question: What is response time?
options: Time taken to respond to request

steps.title: Security Testing Basics (3-4 weeks)
steps.description: Learn security testing fundamentals, OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, Burp Suite, OWASP ZAP, and penetration testing basics.

quiz.question: What is XSS?
quiz.explanation: XSS injects malicious scripts in web pages.

quiz.question: What is Burp Suite?
quiz.explanation: Burp Suite intercepts and analyzes HTTP traffic.

quiz.question: What is CSRF?
quiz.explanation: CSRF tricks users into unwanted actions.

quiz.question: What is API security testing?
options: Testing API authentication, authorization, data validation

steps.title: CI/CD Integration (4-6 weeks)
steps.description: Integrate automated tests with Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, and CircleCI. Learn Docker basics for test environments.

quiz.question: What is CI/CD?
quiz.explanation: CI/CD automates build, test, and deployment.

quiz.question: What is GitHub Actions?
quiz.explanation: GitHub Actions runs workflows on code events.

quiz.question: Why integrate tests in CI/CD?
options: Early defect detection and faster feedback

quiz.question: What is artifact storage?
options: Storing build outputs and test reports
quiz.explanation: Artifacts preserve test results and logs.

quiz.question: What are test reports?
quiz.explanation: Reports provide visibility into test outcomes.

quiz.question: What is rollback strategy?
options: Reverting to previous version on failure

projects.title: Automated UI Test Suite
projects.description: Create an automated test suite for a web application using Selenium WebDriver with page object model pattern.
tasks: Set up Selenium WebDriver with Python
Create page object classes for UI elements
Write test cases for login functionality

projects.title: API Testing Framework
projects.description: Build a comprehensive API testing framework using REST Assured or Postman/Newman with automated test execution and reporting.
tasks: Learn REST API concepts and HTTP methods
Set up REST Assured or Postman collections
Write tests for GET, POST, PUT, DELETE endpoints
Validate response status codes and bodies
Set up CI integration with Newman

projects.title: Mobile App Testing Suite
projects.description: Develop an automated testing framework for mobile applications using Appium for both iOS and Android platforms.
tasks: Set up Appium with Android Studio and Xcode
Write tests for mobile UI interactions
Test app on multiple device resolutions
Implement parallel execution on multiple devices

projects.title: Performance Testing Framework
projects.description: Build a performance testing solution using JMeter or Gatling to test application scalability, load handling, and identify bottlenecks.
tasks: Set up JMeter or Gatling framework
Add database and API performance tests
Set up CI integration for regression testing

projects.title: End-to-End Test Automation Platform
projects.description: Design and implement a complete test automation platform with UI, API, mobile testing, CI/CD integration, reporting dashboard, and test management.
tasks: Set up framework with Selenium, REST Assured, Appium
Set up Docker containers for test execution
